reference: Volume One, Issue Four, Phile #1 of 11
title: Phrack Pro-Phile I
historical_context: This article is one of the early features of Phrack, focusing on the personal backgrounds of notable figures in the phreaking and hacking community during the mid-1980s.
target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, and enthusiasts of hacker culture history.
short_summary: The article introduces Crimson Death, a young sysop and phreaker, detailing his background, interests, and experiences in the hacking community. It provides a glimpse into the culture of the time and the personal stories that shaped it.
summary:
In this inaugural edition of Phrack Pro-Phile, Taran King interviews Crimson Death, a 16-year-old sysop of the Hell Phrozen Over BBS in Philadelphia. The article delves into Crimson's journey into the world of phreaking, starting from his early days with a public BBS to his current private board. It highlights his connections with other notable figures in the community, including his mentor, The Videosmith, and his aspirations to learn more about hacking in the future. The interview captures the essence of a young hacker's life, filled with friendships, challenges, and a passion for technology and telecommunications.

Crimson Death shares personal anecdotes, including his battle with leukemia and his love for music and literature. The article not only serves as a profile of an individual but also reflects the camaraderie and culture of the phreaking community during the 1980s. It emphasizes the importance of personal connections and experiences in shaping the identities of those involved in hacking and phreaking, making it a valuable read for anyone interested in the history of hacker culture.
